Articles.Content:
Hey guys, starting a new series I think will last longer then my Kethane series! Love seeing things burn up into Kerbin's Atmosphere? Or jool's? Maybe Duna or Eve? No matter what your flavor is this is for you! I am currently uploading a video that is the beginning of this series and it is a small refueling station in Kerbin's orbit. We deorbit the station and watch it burn and tear apart as it crashes to the ground!

Now you may be thinking, "Oh watching a station go to the ground is boring!" Well let me give you this thought. I'm not only going to be doing stations, space planes, probes, and anything else that has a escape pod for a Kerbal to have a chance at surviving. Hence the name, "will it survive?" And the next video will consist of a space plane that is stock to KSP. I have far installed which improves aerodynamics and makes it more challening to fly a plane. So in this scenario where there is no escape pod we must land safely.

Now some pictures.

http://imgur.com/a/j0Hw6/

First video:

second video:

Now with that you may be thinking, "this seems like a cool idea, I wish he would take my epic 700 part station and slam it into the ground!" Well if that is the case than I will! I will take your incrediably demanding station and slam it into the ground with pleasure! Just a few guidelines that I ask any "donations" to follow.

1. Name of the station:

2. Part count:

3. Location: I.E Kerbin and altitude.

4. Special requests:

5. Download link here:

6. Picture of craft:

Now all these stations must have an escape system where a escape pod or escape vessel LEAVES the main part of the station it self. Of course if you don't have any escape systems and just have a giant pile driver that is fine too. Just add a single MK1 pod with a chute and a decouple!

Yes I am kindly asking (depending) on people to add their space planes and stations to make an enjoyable series.

Edited November 15, 2013 by 7499275

Finally set aside a little time to take a look, and I have to say: Not bad. There are a few spots where you let the dead space get a little long, overall it's a pretty solid video. I like what you've done with the concept

One thing you might want to consider is dubbing a little bit of background noise over the video. That might help the dead space a little, as well as muffle some of the background noises from your mouse and your computer fan.

Edited November 15, 2013 by Specialist290

Finally set aside a little time to take a look, and I have to say: Not bad. There are a few spots where you let the dead space get a little long, overall it's a pretty solid video. I like what you've done with the concept

One thing you might want to consider is dubbing a little bit of background noise over the video. That might help the dead space a little, as well as muffle some of the background noises from your mouse and your computer fan.

Ah! Yes background noise, I can get some free (legal) music to throw in the back! I realized after I uploaded the noise from the fan and mouse were high. Usually I am able to speak louder so the mic is farther away (Build in pc mic). That being said I had to be quieter because my dad was asleep in the other room so pc was closer. Will work on these issues.

Also just as a note for anyone who is interested 2nd video uploaded last night!
